The worst part of this software is the file selector, even if you follow the directions and choose parent directory it will say "failed listing" and won't navigate to anything! Honestly I can't see how people get this software to work.
replyContent: This will sometimes happen if Android prohibits browsing the parent folder. There is no nice way around this, but there is an effective way. Click on the triple dots in the top-right corner, select "Change Folder" from the menu, then type in the new folder name. This lets you quickly jump where you want to go.

content: Missing features that I wish were here: 1.) Set the app's volume level independent of other apps 2.) Increase font size so that button labels are legible on my phone (pixel2) 3.) Hide all unused buttons 4.) Manually add boxart to the game list, since the app only found the art for one of my games. 5.) Add custom overlay and button graphics 6.) If UI and Button customization improves, I'd like to be able to backup my layout
replyContent: 1) Not a good thing with Android, it really assumes common volume; 2) There are alternative skins with bigger labels (Settings | Input | Edit Joystick); 3) All the currently shown buttons are used; 4) This is possible, just supply your own box art PNGs renaming them to *.box; 5) Also possible right away; 6) Not sure what you mean here.

Much respect. A galaxy of stars if I could. And now back to Wonderboy...

You may need to clear current saves from some of the games (hold finger on a game in File Selector and choose "Delete State and Screenshot"). Very sorry again.

replyContent: ZIP files always show a folder icon. When you click on a ZIP file, MasterGear will unpack the ROM file from it and run it. There will be a separate entry for that ROM file, with the screenshot.

content: Not the best emulation. Also, really frustrating is the box art, no way to select your source. Most of the box arts downloaded are totally wrong.
replyContent: MasterGear relies on Google search for box art, so it sometimes picks the wrong images. You can easily provide your own box art though. For each "Game.sms", create a PNG-format box art image named "Game.sms.box" and place it into the same folder with "Game.sms".

content: Greatest

While this is a great emulator, I have two major issues: 1. The audio compatibility issues. Some of the games like sonic are particularly lot faster than it originally was and should be fixed ASAP. Also the yamaha FM music mode doesn't seem to work at all. I tried r-type and power strike and none of them work at all. 2. The digitized sound effects and voices are completely absent and needs to be fixed ASAP. Again please fix these problem asap as they are great emulators aside from these major issues.
replyContent: As far as I can tell, everything is running at the normal speed. It is possible that you are running a PAL game in NTSC mode: in this case it will get clocked at 60Hz instead of 50Hz, speeding things up. The YM2413 OPLL emulation is currently far from perfect, but I am working on it.

content: The only real advantage this has over the free emulators is that it doesn't have ads. I'd love to have a better navigation feature. It was a pain in the butt finding the ROMS on my SD card. It would be fantastic if it had the ability to select a default folder to go to for roms, and would be even better on top of that if it had a cool home screen like Super Retro 16 (SNES emulator). It does play games fine though, and the sound and video quality is good. Worth 4.99? Probably not, but I got it with a gift card and I don't have to put up with ads, so hey.
replyContent: It already has a way to select the "default folder". Simply use the File Selector to navigate to whatever folder you want (use ".." to go up to a parent folder, if needed). The next time you start MasterGear, it will go to the same folder.

content: I have 3 issues. Maybe you can help me. 1) Why is it every time I open the app, I must research for game files? In other emulators I only have to do it once. 2) Why does it list the file 3x or more when I only downloaded the Rom once? 3) Why does it show every rom? Even the ones for nintendo, n64, ds, and Gameboy. Is there only a way to get master system roms to display? Please help me. Thanks
replyContent: 1) You do not. Simply navigate to the folder where your games are, and it will stay there; 2) Probably because you are using the SEARCH feature and it finds each file three times; 3) Because the SEARCH feature shows every .ZIP file it finds. I think you should stop relying on the SEARCH to find games (see point 1), and that will solve your problem.

content: Some issues I would like to see corrected.  -Input lag.  I'm using a DS3 and I feel like there is a tenth of a second delay.  This is my biggest issue.  -Choppy sound.  100ms is the highest I am willing to set the audio latency and still getting choppy/scratchy sound. Most other higher gen emus get it done in 50 ms or less.  -Video scaling and filtering.  There needs to be an option to set integer scaling (2x, 3x, etc.).  Also, the option to disable linear filtering (smoothing) does nothing.  Please fix.  For the record, I'm currently running on a Nexus 7 (2013).
replyContent: To get the best sound quality, you may want to disable CPU intensive functions: 1) Enable "Accelerated Video" 2) Set "Draw Frames" to 65% 3) Disable "Soften" and "Scanlines" 4) Set sound latency to 100ms or 50ms. See if these work. As to smoothing, OpenGLES video is always smooth. Disable it for crystal clear picture, at the cost of CPU time.

content: Had great fun playing Shinobi again after all these years, now to find my other games!

This emulator works but is buggy and not very user friendly compared to other emulators. It took much too much trial and error to get the settings that I wanted. My biggest complaint is the way the screen scales. If you use hardware acceleration, the screen size is great but it turns otherwise pretty pixels into an ugly blurry mess. If you turn it off, you get your pixels back but the screen shrinks! My other 8-bit emulators don't have this issue, so there really isn't an excuse.
replyContent: You are complaining about something I have no control of: the blur is being added by the OpenGLES hardware in your phone. As to the screen being smaller in the non-accelerated mode, the emulator chooses the best assembler routine to render a pixel-perfect picture. There are routines for several screen sizes, and it picks the closest one.
